item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @Rahmafett Rahmafett
item.description:
@Rahmafett wrote:

Sebo:

yeah, lol, Im finnaly figureing out how to use bitmaps cause im at a frienbds house and bitmap from string works here. cause at my house it gives me like 208549485 lines of bitmap, and i dont know how to fix it.

Take the whole bitmap and use your mouse to select a portion. You can do this right from SCAR.

Read full topic

Only take the most detailed part of the bitmap. Scale it down to there.

item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Sebo, I think he already finished a bitmap version of this. Anyways, I’m curious, why did you use findColor? Aren’t there a lot of very similar colors that could mess up the script?

Read full topic

item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @Sebo Sebo
item.description:
@Sebo wrote:

Thanks for helping me sebo =) :eek:[br][size=1]Posted at: September 17, 2006, 04:55:58 PM[/size][hr][scar] program AutoPost;
var x,y:Integer;
//should work fine now… Maybe now on the posting part and the post
//reply button part lol.
const
Post1 = ‘Thanks for helping me sebo =)’;
begin
Activateclient;
FindColorTolerance(x,y,16777215,632,379,670,387,2);
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y);
ClickMouse(x,y, True);
Wait(15000); //Little too long? Lol
If(FindColor(x,y,16777215,114,544,916,615))Then
MoveMouseSmoothEX(x,y,15,15,15,10,10);
ClickMouse(x,y, True);
Wait(1000);
SendKeysSilent(Post1);
If(findcolor(x,y,16635590,1005,2,1023,615))Then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y);
ClickMouse(x,y, True);
HoldMouse(x,y, True);
MoveMouseSmooth(1012,236);
ReleaseMouse(x,y, True);
If(FindColor(x,y,0,440,417,485,433))then
ClickMouse(x,y, True);
Wait(15000);
WriteLN(‘congratz you just posted…’);
end. [/scar][br][size=1]Posted at: September 17, 2006, 04:57:05 PM[/size][hr]I can help you out, Pm me if you got questions =)

Read full topic

item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @Rahmafett Rahmafett
item.description:
@Rahmafett wrote:

Don’t do co-ordinates, because unless it’s a specified size like a Neopets Flash window or a Runescape Java Window, the co-ordinates will vary on every computer.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well, it didn’t work for me, the coordinates were off by a little bit. I suggest trying bitmaps, so then it will look for the bitmap and click on the bitmap. This is more accurate because the coordinates are different on different machines.

But a good first script, keep it up.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Script [n00b]
item.dc:creator: @uncfan1119 uncfan1119
item.description:
@uncfan1119 wrote:

Setup: Drag Crosshair to this post . Scroll all the way to top, run script.

[scar]program AutoPost;
const
Post1=‘Hey , good 1st n00b script. Keep up the good work.’;
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(647,384);
ClickMouse(647,384,true);
Wait(15000);
MoveMouseSmooth(864,566);
ClickMouse(864,566,true);
Wait (1000);
SendKeysSilent(Post1);
MoveMouseSmooth(877,478);
ClickMouse(877,478,true);
SendKeysSilent(Chr(13));
Wait(15000);

end.[/scar]
Edit:w00t it does work
HopeFully it works. If it does, you end up posting.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 16, 2006, 10:41:35 PM[/size][hr]Hey , good 1st n00b script. Keep up the good work.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 16, 2006, 10:42:02 PM[/size][hr]Comon Someone Try it =D

Read full topic
